intro: Trochomeria verdickii, commonly known as the African goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
